casebody.data:
INTERSAL, INC.
v.
HAMILTON, et al. 115A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. September 20, 2018 David H. Harris, Jr., Attorney at Law, Durham, for Intersal, Inc. Brian Rabinovitz, Special Deputy Attorney General, Olga Vysotskaya de Brito, Special Deputy Attorney General, Amar Majmundar, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Charles G. Whitehead, Special Deputy Attorney General, for North Carolina Department of Natural and Cultural Resources, et al. Jeffrey A. Doyle, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Joshua D. Neighbors, Attorney at Law, for Friends of Queen Anne's Revenge (Non-Profit Corporation).

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 19th of September 2018 by Plaintiff:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 20th of September 2018."

*106Plaintiff shall have up to and including the 24th day of October 2018 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
